attributes.action: Support Brian Matthew, BBC Radio 2 DJ, Sounds of the 60s.
attributes.additional_details:
Brian has been off air for several weeks to recuperate from a fall.
The BBC say it has been mutually agreed that it was “the right time for him to step off the weekly treadmill of presenting the show” but this is not true as Brian was ready and willing and able to go back to work. “I enjoyed doing the show very much indeed. I did it for 25 years. I feel very disconcerted, I must say. I do admit I’m a bit of an antique, but that’s never seemed to matter until now".
attributes.background:
Brian Matthew 88 is Britain’s oldest regular radio presenter and has presented Sounds of the 60s for more than a quarter of a century. He's to be replaced by the BBC in a decision he described as "horrible".
We must support Brian.
